experience.title: Head Of Business Development
experience.description: We at Pharmadeep offer our services for Pharmaceuticals / Herbal / Cosmetic / Veterinary / Chemical and API on a Turnkey basis for the last 18+ years.We operate in more than 15 countries and already accomplished more than 80 Projects in India and more than 20 Projects in Africa, Middle East & South East Asia.Each one of the projects is carried out in accordance with the current international guidelines and regulations of FDA, PICS, GMPs, USFDA, ISO, ICH & WHO GMP, FSSAI, FSSC 22000, ISO 22000, HACCP, and c-GLP and NABL accreditation.In our offering basket, we have services for:- Design & Conceptualization- Detailed Engineering- Project Management- Revamping - Upgrade to c-GMP requirements- Execution of turnkey projects- Post Commissioning ManagementIf you are interested in doing new pharmaceutical projects on a Turnkey Basis and need Consulting Services then please don't hesitate to contact me.Reach me at fazlur@pharmadeep.com

experience.title: Venture Associate in Peaceful Progress Fund, an Angel Fund
experience.description: Peaceful Progress is a SEBI Registered (AIF CAT-1) Angel Fund, investing in Technology-led and Consumer businesses.Invest in technology-enabled startups in emerging sectors such as AI, ML, IoT, VR, MR, non-tech start-ups in the FMCG segment as well as other new-age disruptors.Ticket size would be between INR 1 Cr and INR 3 Cr (~ USD 133K to USD 400K) but can be higher or lower in specific cases. Prefer to invest in Revenue generating start-ups and will co-invest by partnering with Early-stage VCs / Micro VCs and Angel Platforms.

experience.title: Consultant

experience.title: Full-time MBA Student
experience.description: Strathclyde Business School is a triple accredited business school: the only business school in Scotland, and one of only 57 in the world, to be triple accredited, holding accreditation from the international bodies, AMBA, AACSB, and EQUIS. Strathclyde has a reputation for research excellence. Most recently, in the 2008 Research Assessment Exercise, Strathclyde Business School was rated 1st in Scotland and 7th in the UK.Finished MBA from University of Strathclyde Business School, Glasgow•   It's a one year General Management Program focusing on Operations Management, Financial      Management, Marketing Management, and Human Resource Management•   The program is regarded heavily for its Strategy Modules: Strategy Analysis & Evaluation, Making Strategy, Strategic Consulting in Practice, Exploring the International Business Environment•   Students from 18 different nationalities are there in the class. Some classes that work in collaboration with the executive part time and flexible learners provide the opportunity to work with the top executives (CEO, Director). The whole exposure has enabled me to understand working styles across cultures and develop team skills.
experience.description_html: Strathclyde Business School is a triple accredited business school: the only business school in Scotland, and one of only 57 in the world, to be triple accredited, holding accreditation from the international bodies, AMBA, AACSB, and EQUIS. Strathclyde has a reputation for research excellence. Most recently, in the 2008 Research Assessment Exercise, Strathclyde Business School was rated 1st in Scotland and 7th in the UK.Finished MBA from University of Strathclyde Business School, Glasgow• It's a one year General Management Program focusing on Operations Management, Financial Management, Marketing Management, and Human Resource Management• The program is regarded heavily for its Strategy Modules: Strategy Analysis & Evaluation, Making Strategy, Strategic Consulting in Practice, Exploring the International Business Environment• Students from 18 different nationalities are there in the class. Some classes that work in collaboration with the executive part time and flexible learners provide the opportunity to work with the top executives (CEO, Director). The whole exposure has enabled me to understand working styles across cultures and develop team skills.

experience.title: Manager- General Management
experience.description: Role:Accountable for ensuring that the strategic direction of the company was clear and aligned to the business objectives. In-charge of keeping track of progress and on time and to the budget delivery of the projects. Achievements:•	Project Management- Successfully managed 4 projects, budget- $5 million; achieved all goals ahead of schedule and below budget. Effectively handled 50 manpower at any time on various shift patterns.•	Procurement- Procured material worth $1million/annum and ensured correctly, timely and in full placing of all purchase orders•	Supplier Relationship Management- Negotiated contracts and maintained relationships with suppliers all around the world to achieve an overall average cost savings of 10% annually•	Change Management- Pioneered a comprehensive change process to transform traditional ways of working to proactive and modern methods by adequate training resulting in  a 20% increase in production rate•	Supply Chain Management and Logistics- Proactively and independently identified possible process and logistical optimization resulting in a 15% reduction in the raw material procurement time•	Accelerated Overall Equipment Effectiveness (OEE) to 87%, which was previously 82% by proper planning and coordination
experience.description_html: Role:Accountable for ensuring that the strategic direction of the company was clear and aligned to the business objectives. In-charge of keeping track of progress and on time and to the budget delivery of the projects. Achievements:• Project Management- Successfully managed 4 projects, budget- $5 million; achieved all goals ahead of schedule and below budget. Effectively handled 50 manpower at any time on various shift patterns.• Procurement- Procured material worth $1million/annum and ensured correctly, timely and in full placing of all purchase orders• Supplier Relationship Management- Negotiated contracts and maintained relationships with suppliers all around the world to achieve an overall average cost savings of 10% annually• Change Management- Pioneered a comprehensive change process to transform traditional ways of working to proactive and modern methods by adequate training resulting in a 20% increase in production rate• Supply Chain Management and Logistics- Proactively and independently identified possible process and logistical optimization resulting in a 15% reduction in the raw material procurement time• Accelerated Overall Equipment Effectiveness (OEE) to 87%, which was previously 82% by proper planning and coordination

experience.title: Assistant manager- Sales & Business Development
experience.description: Role:Supported the General Manager in effectively managing the plant, labor, and equipment to achieve maximum efficiency and cost-effectiveness. Led the Sales and Marketing department, analyzing, creating and implementing sales strategies to match clients’ need with the best quality of products and services in maximizing profits to the company.Sales Achievements:•	Increased the sales of 3 products by 10%, 20%,  and 25%, respectively, by employing the four Ps of marketing•	Supported a corporate customer saving more than $ 1 million of the corporate budget by accurately analyzing company requirements•	Retained a corporate customer providing the annual income of $ 200K, after a botch up by a company representativeSupplier Relationship Management-•	Consolidated supplier base by 15% through the elimination of subpar suppliers by using established supplier performance measurement metrics.Project Management:•	Team leader of the Pot Revival Project, budget- $35 million; zero accidents during the term; project completed 6 days before the scheduled date and below budget (around 2%) •	Team Management- Efficiently handled around 100 manpower (including contractor labor) at any time on various shift patterns (24/7)•	Ensured compliance to all Quality Control (ISO 9001:2008, ISO 14001:2004, TQM), and Environmental Health & Safety (OHSAS-18001:2007) objectivesProcurement Achievements:•       Oversaw company's procurement and strategic sourcing with over $12 million/annum in spending. •	Reduced more than $1.5 million in 2012 by accurately analyzing company needs and introducing strategic procurement plans•	Analyzed the industry trends to minimize risk and explore emerging opportunities which resulted in 8 new sources of raw material suppliers in India, China, and AustraliaChange Management-•	Led more than 10 idea generation workshops with suppliers and internal stakeholders. Monitored the process and reduced the Cost of Production (COP) by 8.3%

projects: [{"title":"Evaluation of Centralized Serialization Approach for Healthcare Company (Confidential) in the USA","start_date":"Jul 2015","description":"Serialization is about allocating a unique serial number to the lowest usable or saleable unit. Regulatory agencies in many countries mandate Serialization as a way of improving patient safety by identifying counterfeit medications. Drug manufacturers are therefore required to implement Serialization capabilities within their impacted manufacturing processes, the result being significant costs in operations. The company has adopted a decentralized approach which means Serialization capabilities are replicated at numerous plants. The Overall cost to implement Serialization is approximate $1.2M for the first line and $600K for each additional line within the same facility. The majority of the costs associated with Serialization implementation comes from the Hardware and software purchases. There are also reoccurring costs to maintain IT solutions lifecycle costs, which adds significantly to the overall plant overhead cost structure. The goal of our project is to conduct an evaluation/cost-benefit analysis of a proposed centralized approach to support company's operations which ultimately will help the company decide whether implementing such an approach will have any long term cost saving benefits."},{},{},{"title":"Evaluating the Global Operations Strategy for Accenture","start_date":"Jun 2015","description":"This was a short time bound project where we were evaluating the global operations strategy for Accenture, particularly its consulting leg. Our work included an environment and organization fit check, competitor analysis, global consulting performance and comparison and suggestions to optimize operation globally.Note: This was a dummy project and didn't require direct contact or association with the organization."},{},{},{},{},{"title":"Operations Management","start_date":"Nov 2014","description":"In this project we analysed the operations strategy of the BMW company. The project essentially defines the organisation as a conversion process. It explores how the BMW company sets-up its operations and makes them coherent with their overall operations strategy. It defines the key aspects of directing, designing, managing and improving the operations systems which addresses an understanding of the operations function in a global context. The project provided a theoretical framework for thinking about operations in both manufacturing and service contexts of the organisation and recommended practical applications for its operations management."},{},{},{"title":"Analytical Support for Decision Making","start_date":"Oct 2014","description":"Achieved a high award for this project in the MBA program. The project examines the efficacy of the Primary, Secondary & Territory education system in Brazil over time impacting the growth of its economy and then makes recommendation to improve the system using world class benchmark standards for our client, The Education Minister of Brazil. We evaluate Brazil's education system by analyzing the World Bank data available to identify its progress over the last 30 years and then compare this data with other South American countries to understand the standard of progress in this region. The project then identifies a benchmark education system such as Switzerland, co-relates its economic growth with its efficacy in education system and then makes recommendation of such standards to the Education Minister of Brazil. The benchmark standard is identified by using statistical tools of collection, interpretation and analysis of qualitative and quantitative data to inform decision making for the Education Minister. The project pays close attention to the understanding and modelling of variability, uncertainty and risk and of multiple, conflicting priorities leading to identification of relationships in data, forming correlation with economic indicators and then making possible recommendations and forecasts to the education minister."},{},{},{"title":"Exploring the International Business Environment","start_date":"Sep 2014","description":"A strategy based scenario building project carried out for our client \"Asian Development Bank\"​ in regards to the economic development operations in \"Developing Member Countries\" such as Kazakhstan. The project examines the countries contextual (or macro) environment ‘driving forces’, the large-scale fundamental forces in the environment and their causal and inter-relatedness that bring about change in the patterns and trends that we identified as underpinning observable events effecting the performance of the existing Millennium Development Goals in Kazakhstan. On the basis of such assumptions the projects makes prediction of various scenarios as an outcome in the future and makes necessary recommendations to the client to prepare for such uncertainties in the future. The time horizon used for this project was 2015 to 2030."},{},{},{},{},{}]
